noun.description: A result or effect of an action or condition.
examples: many have been laid off from work as a consequence of the administration's policies
the past is of no consequence
he didn't say anything of great consequence

phrases: Haven't I been present as a student at many operations which ought never to have been done, and in several cases the patient has died in consequence?
That was in consequence of a misunderstanding between myself and a young person.
And in consequence, letters became an absolutely key means of communication.
They ought, in consequence, to attract the nation's sympathy.
Their prescriptions, in consequence, dramatically differ from those of the deep ecologists.
origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin consequentia, from consequent- following closely, from the verb consequi.
